meanings.definition: A carbohydrate polymer found in plant cell walls.
meanings.sent1: The callose in the plant cell walls provides structural support.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the role of callose in plant biology.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to eat the callose, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The callose acted like a shield, protecting the plant cell from harm.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the intricate patterns of callose were fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: A substance that forms a barrier in plant cells in response to injury or stress.
meanings.sent1: When the plant was wounded, callose quickly formed to seal the damaged area.
meanings.sent2: The presence of callose indicated that the plant was under duress.
meanings.sent3: The callose barricade prevented the harmful invaders from entering the plant cell.
meanings.sent4: In times of trouble, the plant cells produced callose as a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The callose barrier was like a fortress, keeping the plant safe from harm.
